ps6
Class DirectionsFinder

java.lang.Object
  ps6.DirectionsFinder

public class DirectionsFinder
extends Object

A DirectionsFinder produces directions for traveling from one address to another in a particular geographical area. Geographical information is obtained from a valid Tiger Database Directory, a directory of geographical street and address information.

Specification Fields
  • segments - : set[StreetSegment] // the set of StreetSegments which represents the geographical area for which this DirectionsFinder produces directions
  • geographicMap - : graph[StreetSegment] // the graph representing the geographic area to be operated over by DirectionsFinder.
  • streetIndex - : Map[String, Set[StreetSegment] ] // an index of all street names within this geographic area, with each name mapped to all street segments with that name.
  • zipcodeFilter - : Collection[String] // collection of zipcodes that this geographic area is constrained to, or if nothing contained, then there is no zipcode limit to the area's coverage.

Method Detail

getDirectionsFinder

public static DirectionsFinder getDirectionsFinder(String databaseName,
                                                   Collection<String> zf)
                                            throws InvalidDatabaseException
Produces a DirectionsFinder for a given database.

Parameters:
databaseName - the database to find directions in
zf - a collection of zipcodes used for zipcode filtering. Only matching zipcodes will be used. If zf is empty or null then there is no zipcode filtering for the database.
Returns:
A DirectionsFinder whose set of segments is { s | s in (new StreetSegReader(databaseName)).streetSegs () && (s.leftZip in zf || s.rightZip in zf || (s.leftZip.trim () == s.rightZip.trim () == "") || zf == null) }
Throws:
InvalidDatabaseException - if databaseName does not refer to a valid tiger database.

getDirections

public Directions getDirections(Address start,
                                Address end,
                                RouteFormatter routeFormat)
                         throws InvalidAddressException,
                                NoPathException
Gets directions from start to end.

Returns:
A Directions providing directions of travel from start to end.
Throws:
InvalidAddressException - if start or end is not in the geographical area covered by this DirectionsFinder.
NoPathException - if no path could be found from start to end.
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified RouteFormatter is null
Requires:
routeFormat != null

checkAddress

public int checkAddress(Address addr)
returns true if the specified address addr is a valid address, that is streetIndex contains a StreetSegment sts such that sts.name == addr.name && sts.contains(addr.number, addr.zipcode)

Returns:
an int value equal to class constants defined for this class: ADDRESS_VALID if the specified address is a valid address ADDRESS_ZIPCODE_INVALID if the address zipcode is invalid ADDRESS_STREET_INVALID if the address street name is not within the address zipcode ADDRESS_NUM_INVALID if the address number is invalid for an existing street ADDRESS_NULL if the address object is null

findFullSegment

public StreetSegment findFullSegment(GeoSegment gs)
Searches for the StreetSegment companion to the specified GeoSegment using the segment indexes built within this instance of DirectionsFinder. Designed to find full-length StreetSegments for fractional segments as well (as fractional segments are never contained within the underlying Graph collection) .

Returns:
the StreetSegment that the specified GeoSegment refers to, even if that GeoSegment is fractional
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if street not found
Requires:
specified GeoSegment must correspond to a street within the graph whether a whole or a fractional segment

getContext

public Collection<StreetSegment> getContext(int[] minMaxLatLon,
                                            Route rt)
Determines nearby segments of the Graph to the specified Route.

Returns:
collection of all segments of the Graph that fall within the specified latitude and longitude bounds and connect somehow to the specified Route
